excerpt: Popular waterfront destination with a lighthouse, a historic pier & cruises in quaint houseboats.
detail_description: Alappuzha Beach is a popular waterfront destination in Kerala, offering visitors a chance to explore its historic pier and enjoy cruises in quaint houseboats. The area hosts the famous Alappuzha Beach Festival and the Nehru Trophy Boat Race, providing an opportunity to experience vibrant festivals showcasing Kerala's traditions. Additionally, visitors can explore the Revi Karunakaran Museum to delve into the region's cultural heritage.
name: Alappuzha Beach
address: Kerala, India

detail_description: Mullakkal Rajarajeswari Temple, located in the heart of Alleppey, is a significant religious site dedicated to Goddess Rajarajeswari. This 500-year-old temple showcases classic Kerala-style architecture and hosts the annual festival of Mullakkal Chirappu, lasting for 41 days. The temple's inclusive nature welcomes devotees from all castes and religions, reflecting the spirit of secularism in Kerala.
name: Mullakkal Rajarajeswari Temple
address: rajeswari temple, opposite Alappuzha, Mullakkal, Alappuzha, Kerala 688009, India

detail_description: St. Mary's Church Punnamada offers a serene and spacious atmosphere, with ample parking and a tranquil setting for worship in the midst of the city. Its unique exterior design resembling an ancient temple adds to its charm, while the nearby parish hall and graveyard provide convenience for parishioners. The church is well-maintained and exudes a traditional ambiance, making it a cherished place for those who live nearby.
name: St. Mary's Church Punnamada
address: Punnamada Thondankulangara Road, Punnamada, Kottankulangara, Alappuzha, Kerala 688006, India

excerpt: Red-&-white striped lighthouse, founded in 1862, with panoramic views & a small history museum.
detail_description: Alappuzha Light House, a red-and-white striped lighthouse built in 1862, offers panoramic views of the coastline and backwaters. It also houses a small history museum where visitors can learn about its rich maritime heritage. This historic structure served as a navigational aid for sailors during the 18th and 19th centuries when Alleppey was a major trading port in Kerala.
name: Alappuzha Light House
address: CCSB Rd, Civil Station Ward, Alappuzha, Kerala 688012, India

excerpt: Large, sandy beach with an old pier, adjacent park & occasional events & festivals.
detail_description: Alleppey Beach, also known as Alappuzha Beach, is a stunning destination with a long coastline and breathtaking beauty. The beach features an old pier, adjacent park, and occasional events and festivals. Surrounded by palm trees, an ancient lighthouse, and lush gardens along the shore, it offers a mesmerizing natural scenic beauty. Visitors can also explore the Krishnapuram Palace to gain insight into Kerala's culture and history.
name: Alleppey Beach
address: Civil Station Ward, Alappuzha, Kerala 688012, India

excerpt: Elegant museum showcasing a private family collection, with a diverse array of religious artwork.
detail_description: Revi Karunakaran Memorial Museum is a captivating destination that offers a glimpse into an extensive private family collection, featuring a diverse range of religious artwork. The museum boasts stunning marble and crystal installations, along with a dedicated Kerala Room showcasing the state's art and culture. Art enthusiasts will be drawn to the vast collection of Tanjore paintings and the impressive 250 ft tall mural.
name: Revi Karunakaran Memorial Museum
address: XVIII/990-A, VCSB Road, near Power House Bridge, Alappuzha, Kerala 688012, India

detail_description: The Nehru Trophy Boat Race, also known as Vallam Kali, is a significant annual event held in memory of Jawaharlal Nehru. Taking place in August on Lake Vembanad, it is a unique and vibrant boat racing competition that showcases the cultural heritage of Kerala. Alongside this event, Alappuzha hosts the famous Alappuzha Beach Festival during November, offering visitors the chance to experience the region's traditions and festivities.
name: NEHRU TROPHY BOAT RACE
address: G922+5X4, Punnamada, Finishing Point, Alappuzha, Kerala 688013, India

detail_description: The Alleppey Backwaters, also known as the Alappuzha backwaters, are a must-visit destination in Kerala. This picturesque network of tranquil waterways is surrounded by lush greenery and charming villages, offering a serene and peaceful experience for all types of travelers. Originally used for transportation, fishing, and agriculture, the backwaters have now become a popular tourist hotspot.
name: Alleppey Backwaters
address: Punnamada, Kottankulangara, Alappuzha, Kerala 688006, India

excerpt: Serene Keralan backwater water body known for its long boat races, festivals & rustic houseboats.
detail_description: Punnamada Lake, located in Alleppey, Kerala, is a captivating destination known for its exhilarating Nehru Trophy Boat Race. This serene Keralan backwater water body attracts visitors from around the world who come to enjoy boat rides and fishing expeditions. During the annual Onam season, Punnamada Lake becomes the center of attention as it hosts the famous Nehru Snake Boat Race.
name: Punnamada Lake
address: Alappuzha, Kerala

detail_description: The Backwaters of Alappuzha, also known as Alleppey Backwaters, offer a serene and enchanting experience for travelers. These backwaters were historically used for transportation, fishing, and agriculture but have now become a popular tourist destination. Visitors can explore the tranquil canals surrounded by palm trees and paddy fields while witnessing the timeless beauty of rural Kerala. The main attraction is the overnight journey on traditional houseboats that offer luxurious accommodations and open decks for relaxation.
name: Backwaters
address: G9F4+GXF, Punnamada, Alappuzha, Kerala 688006, India

excerpt: Small museum featuring exhibits on the history of the coir industry, plus unique coir-made objects.
detail_description: The International Coir Museum, located in Kalavoor, Alleppey, is a small but fascinating institution that showcases the history and evolution of the coir industry. Visitors can explore exhibits on traditional coir production methods as well as the latest advancements in the field. The museum features unique coir-made objects and offers a brief video presentation that takes guests through the journey of coir from its origins to modern developments. With its convenient location just 8.
name: INTERNATIONAL COIR MUSEUM
address: H88H+9QG, COIRBOARD COMPLEX GOVT.OF.INDIA KALAVOOR.PO. ALAPUZHA. Kochi, Panvel - Kochi - Kanyakumari Hwy, Kalavoor, Alappuzha, Kerala 688522, India

excerpt: Basic, undeveloped stretch of sand & palm trees, a popular landing site for local fishermen.
detail_description: Thumpoly Beach is a serene and undeveloped stretch of coastline, known for its natural beauty and tranquility. It serves as a hub for local fishermen and is dotted with fishing villages. The beach offers stunning views of the Indian Ocean, making it an ideal spot to unwind and take in the breathtaking panoramas. While not frequented by tourists, it provides a unique experience for those seeking a peaceful retreat. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks along the shore or seek shelter under the palm trees.
name: Thumpoly Beach
address: Kerala, India

detail_description: Triveni Market in Alleppey is a vibrant destination that rivals the famous floating markets of Bangkok and Kashmir. While it may offer fewer types of items, it is still a bustling hub for all-purpose goods. The market promises an exciting experience with its colorful array of products, making it a must-visit spot in Alleppey.
name: Triveni Market
address: F88Q+JPC, National Highway 47, Kalarcode, Thookkukulam, Paravur, Kerala 688003, India

detail_description: Udupi Sri Krishna Temple, located in Alappuzha, is an ancient and popular pilgrimage site in Kerala. The temple, built in the 8th century AD, showcases typical Kerala style architecture and is renowned for serving Pala Payasam to devotees. The majestic granite structures with copper pyramidical roofs were built by the local ruler Chembakassery Rajah.
name: Udupi Sri Krishna Temple, Alappuzha
address: SH40, Thondankulangara, Alappuzha, Kerala 688013, India

excerpt: Hemmed by a dense treeline, this wide sand beach is known for its many fishing boats & remote vibe.
detail_description: Punnapra Beach is a serene and remote destination, offering a break from the crowded tourist spots in Alleppey. Nestled among a dense treeline, this wide sandy beach is dotted with fishing boats, providing an authentic glimpse into local life. It's known for its tranquil atmosphere and is generally less crowded, making it perfect for those seeking peace and solitude.
name: Punnapra Beach
address: Kerala, India

excerpt: Amusement park with over 50 rides, a virtual reality cinema, magic shows & pedal boating.
detail_description: Seaview Park, located near Alappuzha Beach, is a beautiful garden that provides a refreshing break for visitors. It offers over 50 rides, a virtual reality cinema, magic shows, and pedal boating. The park is an ideal destination for family outings and adventure tourism experiences. Visitors can enjoy activities such as ziplining, rope rides, paddle boats, kayaking, and even a 12D video experience.
name: Seaview Park
address: Beach Rd, Sea View Ward, Alappuzha, Kerala 688012, India

detail_description: Vijay Park, situated on the southern side of the Alappuzha backwaters in Kerala, is a delightful initiative by the state government. It features an array of activities for both kids and adults, including swings, slides, thrilling rides, boating facilities, and a toy train that takes children around the park. Additionally, there's Amaze World with electronic games and a 9-D Theatre.
name: Vijay Park
address: Alappuzha Bypass Rd, Vellappally, Sea View Ward, Alappuzha, Kerala 688007, India

detail_description: Experience the enchanting Backwater Cruise in Alleppey, Kerala aboard traditional 'Kettuvalloms' as you leisurely glide through the serene backwaters. Admire the idyllic scenery of coconut groves and quaint island villages, immersing yourself in the dreamy tableau of Kerala. Let go of stress as you savor delectable seafood meals on board and capture picture-perfect moments at floating markets for unforgettable memories.
name: Backwater Cruise
address: G922+HPF, Finishing Point Rd, Punnamada, Finishing Point, Alappuzha, Kerala 688013, India

detail_description: Thiruvampady Sree Krishna Swami Temple, also known as the Dwarka of the South, is a renowned Vaishnava temple in Travancore. Dating back to the 13th century, this Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Krishna showcases traditional Kerala-style architecture. Located in Alappuzha Municipal Town, it stands out for its lack of sub-deities or sub-shrines and features two large temple ponds on either side.
name: Thiruvampady Sree Krishna Swami Temple, Alappuzha
address: Thiruvampady Sree Krishna Temple Road, Thiruvambady, P. O, Alappuzha, Kerala 688002, India

name: Kayaking
address: Punnamada Alappy, Mullakkal, Kerala 688006, India

excerpt: Sprawling lake with a lush shoreline known for its bird preserve, boating, fishing & festivals.
detail_description: Vembanad Lake is a sprawling body of water with a lush shoreline that is famous for its bird preserve, boating, fishing, and festivals. The area surrounding the lake includes the small lagoon at the East coast under the St. John Nepumseanos Church Shrine near the Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary Observatory Tower. The underwater landscape of this biotope features shallow waters that fill up as the lake level changes, with transparent water and muddy bottoms due to uncontrolled shell mining.
name: Vembanad Lake
address: Kerala

excerpt: Coconut trees line this long, scenic beach with white sand, waves & an adjacent lagoon.
detail_description: Marari Beach is a stunning coastal stretch with white sand, coconut trees, and a serene lagoon. The area is home to luxurious resorts inspired by local fishing villages, offering Ayurveda treatments and yoga classes on the beach. This quaint village near Alleppey boasts rich culture and traditions, making it an ideal destination for a relaxing beach vacation. National Geographic has recognized Marari Beach as one of the top Hammock Beaches in the World.
name: Marari beach
address: South.P.O, SH40, Mararikkulam,Mararikkulam, Cherthala, Kerala 688523, India

excerpt: Champakulam is a village in Kerala, India. It is in Alappuzha district. Champakulam is part of Kuttanad, the rice bowl of Kerala, and is resplendent in green paddy fields, coconut groves and water fowl. Champakulam is an important tourist spot and is famous for the Champakulam Moolam Boat Race. Wikipedia.
name: Champakulam
address: Kerala, India

excerpt: Punnapra is a village in Alappuzha district of Kerala, India. It is a coastal area of the Arabian Sea and lies west to Kuttanad, popularly known as The rice bowl of Kerala. Punnapra is located on NH 66 of about 8 km south of district headquarters Alappuzha. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Punnapra, a coastal village in the Alappuzha district of Kerala, India, is situated on NH 66 about 8 km south of the district headquarters. It is known for its historical significance as the site of a fierce confrontation between communists and the Travancore State Police during the Punnapra Vayalar Communist uprising of 1946. The village is also close to Kuttanad, which is famous for being 'The rice bowl of Kerala.'
name: Punnapra
address: Alappuzha, Kerala, India

detail_description: Alleppey Houseboats, also known as Alleppey Boat Houses, offer a unique and relaxing way to experience the beauty of Alleppey's backwaters. These houseboats can be found at various locations throughout the area, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in the serene surroundings of mangroves and coconut trees. The booking process is convenient, with responsive staff members like Libin Joseph providing excellent service and support throughout the stay.
name: Alleppey Houseboats | Alleppey Boat House - Waves and Dales Alleppey Houseboat
address: Boat Jetty Rd, near Boat Jetty, Finishing Point, Alappuzha, Kerala 688006, India

excerpt: Alappuzha (or Alleppey) is a city on the Laccadive Sea in the southern Indian state of Kerala. It's best known for houseboat cruises along the rustic Kerala backwaters, a network of tranquil canals and lagoons. Alappuzha Beach is the site of the 19th-century Alappuzha Lighthouse. The city's Mullakkal Temple features a traditional design. Punnamada Lake's snake boat races are a well-known annual event.
detail_description: Alappuzha, also known as Alleppey, is a charming city in Kerala, India, situated along the serene Laccadive Sea. It's renowned for its picturesque backwaters where visitors can enjoy leisurely houseboat cruises. The city boasts the historic Alappuzha Beach and Lighthouse, as well as the traditional Mullakkal Temple. One of its highlights is the annual snake boat races held at Punnamada Lake.
name: Alappuzha
address: Kerala, India

excerpt: Basilica on a site where Syrian Christians established a Catholic church over 1000 years ago.
detail_description: The Kalloorkad St. Mary's Basilica is a historic Catholic church located in Alleppey, built on the site where Syrian Christians established a church over 1000 years ago. Constructed in 427 AD, this beautiful basilica is renowned for its architecture and rich legacy which draws tourists from all over the world. The church hosts two festivals annually to commemorate various occasions, attracting a large number of visitors.
name: Kalloorkad St. Mary's Basilica
address: Champakulam, Kerala 688505, India

detail_description: Alappuzha Boat house, also known as the Alappuzha houseboat, offers a unique and enchanting experience through the backwaters of Kerala. The overnight cruises are considered a must-do in Kerala despite being a bit pricey. The charming houseboats are exquisitely constructed with elaborate carvings, thatched roofs, and bamboo structures creating a peaceful and rustic atmosphere. Additionally, visitors can enjoy shikara boat rides for stunning views of the water and surrounding landscapes.
name: Alappuzha Boat house
address: Nehru Trophy Boat Race, Finishing Point, Alappuzha, Kerala 688513, India

detail_description: Alleppey Boat House offers a unique and serene experience as you glide through the picturesque landscape, passing by charming villages and lush greenery. For those seeking adventure, there are opportunities for canoeing and kayaking to explore hidden nooks along the waterways. While the onboard food may not be exceptional, the breathtaking views and mesmerizing water lilies make it worthwhile.
name: Alleppey Boat House
address: G82M+5M7, opposite Indian Oil Petrol Station Near Vazhicherry Bridge, VCNB Road, Alappuzha, Kerala 688001, India

detail_description: Alleppey Backwaters, located at the Vembanad Lake in Kerala, is a paradise for bird watchers and nature enthusiasts. The Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary offers a mesmerizing experience with its diverse native and migratory bird population. Visitors can rent houseboats and motor boats to enhance their bird watching adventure. Additionally, the Alleppey Beach attracts numerous tourists with its serene shores, golden sands, and palm tree-lined coast.
name: Alleppey Backwaters
address: G99J+2PF, Meenappally, Kuttamangalam, Kuppapuram, Kainakary North, Kerala 688501, India

excerpt: Beachfront hub for seafood, curries & noodles, plus beer & wine in rustic digs with outdoor seating.
detail_description: THE HARBOUR Bar & Beer Parlour in Alappuzha is a beachfront restaurant offering a variety of seafood, curries, and noodles along with an extensive selection of beer and wine. The rustic setting provides outdoor seating for guests to enjoy their meals while taking in the beautiful surroundings. The restaurant offers a mix of Indian and Continental cuisine, making it an ideal spot for a delightful evening meal.
name: THE HARBOUR Bar & Beer Parlour, Alappuzha
address: F8V9+HC5, Beach Rd, Sea View Ward, Alappuzha, Kerala 688012, India

detail_description: Embarking on a Shikara boat ride in Alleppey is truly an unforgettable experience that should be on every traveler's bucket list. For around INR 800 to 1,000 for a two-hour journey, you can glide through the serene backwaters while soaking in breathtaking scenery and fresh air. Many travelers find this option even more enjoyable than traditional houseboat rides. Along the way, you might stop at charming little restaurants where freshly fried fish and prawns await your taste buds.
name: Shikara Boat Alleppey
address: Poonthoppu Marys School, Ward Rd, Chungam, Alappuzha, Kerala 688006, India

detail_description: Pulickattil Handicrafts is a must-visit shopping destination in Alleppey, known for its impressive collection of authentic items such as wooden shikaras, brass conches, and traditional Indian dance-drama artifacts like Kathakali faces. Located in the Mullackal area, this store offers a wide range of Kerala handicrafts and handlooms. Visitors praise the attentive customer service and meticulous packaging provided by the friendly staff.
name: Pulickattil Handicrafts
address: Boat Jetty Rd, Mullakkal, Alappuzha, Kerala 688013, India

name: Alleppey Nightstay Houseboats
address: Kannittachira house, Avalookunnu PO, Punnamada, Alappuzha, Kerala 688006, India

excerpt: 13th-century Hindu temple & monastery devoted to Lord Krishna, with daily services offered.
detail_description: Sree Krishna Swamy Temple, Ambalapuzha is a 13th-century Hindu temple and monastery dedicated to Lord Krishna. Also known as Dwaraka of South, this temple follows the traditional architecture of Kerala. It is famous for its sweet milk rice pudding called Pal Payasam and boasts an exquisite collection of mural paintings depicting Lord Vishnu's ten avatars.
name: Ambalappuzha Sree Krishna Swamy Temple
address: SH 12, Ambalapuzha, Kerala 688561, India

excerpt: A vast number of snake images adorn this popular pilgrimage site & temple to serpent gods.
detail_description: Mannarasala Sree Nagaraja Temple is a captivating pilgrimage destination located in the heart of Kerala, dedicated to the revered serpent god, Nagaraja. This ancient temple is renowned for its serene forest setting and boasts an impressive collection of over 100,000 snake images that line the pathways and trees, making it one of the largest snake temples in India.
name: Mannarasala Sree Nagaraja Temple
address: Mannarasala P.O, Haripad, Kerala 690514, India

name: Sree Subrahmanya Swami Temple Payyanur
address: 36X3+3RX, Payyanur, Kerala 670307, India

excerpt: This stone church, with a carved teak altar depicting the Last Supper, is a pilgrimage site.
detail_description: St. Andrew's Latin Catholic Basilica, Arthunkal, is a remarkable stone church that stands as a significant pilgrimage site in South India. Renowned for its stunning carved teak altar showcasing the Last Supper, this basilica attracts visitors from far and wide. Established in the 16th century and rebuilt in 1584 under the guidance of Father Jacomo Feniciowho was known for his miraculous healing touchthe church has undergone several renovations while maintaining its historical essence.
name: St. Andrew's Roman Catholic Basilica Church, Arthunkal
address: Arthunkal, Cherthala South, Kerala 688530, India

excerpt: This coastal area for swimming & fishing has eateries with water views & a relaxed vibe.
detail_description: Andhakaranazhi Beach, located 30 kilometers from Kochi, is a hidden gem that offers a relaxed and uncommercialized coastal experience. This virgin beach is an extension of the village of Andhakaranazhi and remains relatively unexploited by tourism. The area is known for its picturesque views of the Arabian Sea, pristine sandy shores, coconut groves, and quaint lighthouse. Fishing is a common sight here as it serves as the main occupation for locals.
name: Andhakaranazhi Beach
address: Kerala, India

detail_description: The Thiruvanvandoor Mahavishnu Temple in Kerala, South India, is a Hindu temple dedicated to Vishnu. It follows the traditional Kerala architectural style and is revered in the Nalayira Divya Prabandham, a Tamil scripture from ancient times. This temple is one of the 108 Divya Desams devoted to Vishnu and is known as Paambanaiappan.
name: Thiruvanvandoor Sree Mahavishnu Temple
address: 8HQJ+X63, Temple Road, Thiruvanvandoor, Kerala 689109, India

detail_description: Saras Exotic Bird Farm is a unique place run by an elderly couple who have a passion for birds and animals. For a small fee, visitors can enjoy viewing the various species of birds and animals on the property. The proceeds from the entry fees go to charity, as the couple does not profit from this endeavor. Additionally, the wife showcases her talent in painting while managing the farm. Despite being closed due to COVID-19, Dr.
name: Saras exotic bird farm
address: G8FG+CXQ, Poomkavu, Alappuzha, Kerala 688008, India

detail_description: Ann's ARTCADE is a must-visit destination for art enthusiasts in Alleppey. The collection features works from both emerging and established artists, all thoughtfully curated in a well-organized manner. The venue itself is stunning, making it an ideal spot to immerse oneself in the world of art.
name: Ann's ARTCADE
address: Thumpoly Kurisadi Road, Thumpoly, Alappuzha, Kerala 688008, India

name: Champions Boat League Finishing Point , Kainakary
address: F9PM+6W7, Kuttamangalam, Kainakary, Kainakary South, Kerala 688501, India
